properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for today into Friday. Snow is expected to move into the area this morning and continue into Friday. Total snowfall amounts of 10 to 20 cm are expected. Poor winter driving conditions especially on Highway 17 are expected due to accumulating snow and low visibility. Motorists should consider changing travel plans accordingly. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-05T03:14:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-04T11:15:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2490920138.2021
Area: Manitouwadge - Hornepayne, White River - Dubreuilville
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for Thursday into Friday. Snow is expected to move into the area Thursday morning and continue into Friday. Total snowfall amounts of 10 to 15 cm are expected. Poor winter driving conditions especially on Highway 17 are expected due to accumulating snow and low visibility. Motorists should consider changing travel plans accordingly. At this point it appears the heaviest snowfall amounts will remain confined to areas immediately along the shore of Lake Superior where snowfall warnings are in effect. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-04T20:19:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-04T04:20:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0471353306.2021
Area: White River - Dubreuilville

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High southerly winds are gusting to near 90 km/h this morning. Winds will gradually diminish during the morning. High southerly winds will reach near 100 km/h during the day on Friday. ### Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-05T01:21:53-00:00

Area: Salluit

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for this afternoon and evening. Periods of light snow have begun across the area. The snow is expected to increase in intensity late this morning and persist into the evening hours. Poor winter driving conditions are expected this afternoon due to accumulating snow, particularly on Highways 11 and 17. Motorists should consider changing travel plans accordingly. Total snowfall amounts of 7 to 12 cm are expected by the time the snow tapers off overnight, with some areas possibly approaching 15 cm. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-05T03:08:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-04T11:09:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2402192235.2021
Area: City of Thunder Bay, Beardmore - Jellicoe - Macdiarmid, Gull Bay - Black Sturgeon Lake, Upsala - Raith, Cloud Bay - Dorion, Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: 20 to 30 cm snow by Friday morning. A weather system will move over southern BC today spreading snow to the region. Segments of the Coquihalla Highway - Hope to Merritt and Highway 3 - Hope to Princeton via Allison Pass will receive 20 to 30 cm snow by Friday morning. Another system will approach the region Friday night. Additional snow of up to 15 cm can be expected on Saturday. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-05T05:00:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-04T13:01:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1817540456.2021
Area: Highway 3 - Hope to Princeton via Allison Pass, Coquihalla Highway - Hope to Merritt
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Total snowfall: 10 to 20 cm. Maximum wind gusts: northerly 60 km/h. Locations: Hopedale and vicinity. Time span: overnight tonight until Thursday evening. Remarks: Fresh snowfall will combine with strong northerly winds overnight tonight and Thursday to give poor visibilities in snow and blowing snow. Conditions will improve Thursday evening as the winds ease. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-02-04T18:42:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-04T02:43:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2669058142.2021
Area: Hopedale and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Extremely cold wind chills between -55 and -60 are expected again tonight in several Arctic communities. These extremely cold conditions may persist through the week in some communities. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-04T19:45:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-04T03:46:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3343987339.2021
Area: Resolute
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for tonight. Snow is expected to arrive in the area this evening. This snow will be heaviest in the first 3 to 5 hours after onset, with snowfall rates of 2-3 cm per hour possible at times. Accumulations of 7 to 15 cm are expected by Friday morning. Poor winter driving conditions are expected tonight due to accumulating snow and very poor visibility at times. Motorists should consider changing travel plans accordingly. The snow is expected to taper off Friday morning. Snow squalls are forecast to develop off Lake Superior by Friday afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-05T03:46:18-00:00

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 15 cm is expected. Snow is occurring behind a low pressure system now in Ontario. Near the Ontario border, east of Lake Winnipeg, snowfall amounts are likely to exceed 10 cm before tapering off today. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow becoming heavy tonight. Snow has begun and will become heavy tonight. It will continue through Friday before tapering to light flurries Friday night. Total snowfall amounts of 20 to 30 cm is expected. Strong northwesterly winds gusting up to 50 km/h will develop on Friday resulting in localized areas of blowing snow. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow becoming heavy this afternoon into tonight. Light snow has begun and will increase in intensity later today into tonight. The snow will ease in intensity Friday morning before ending later in the day. Total snowfall amounts of 20 to 30 cm are likely by the time the snow comes to an end. Travel conditions along Highway 17 between Nipigon and Wawa will likely become hazardous due to accumulating snow and very low visibility. Motorists should consider changing travel plans accordingly. The town of Wawa is expected to receive lesser amounts than areas farther west along the shore of Lake Superior. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for tonight. Snow is expected to move into southwestern Ontario after 6 PM EST and advance northeastward as the evening progresses. At any location, the heaviest snowfall is most likely during the first two or three hours after onset, with lighter snowfall expected after that. Total snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 cm are possible tonight with the bulk of the precipitation likely coming in the first few hours. Road conditions are expected to rapidly deteriorate once the snow arrives. Untreated roads may suddenly become snow covered and slippery. Motorists should allow for extra time to reach their destination. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-05T07:53:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-04T15:54:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3642689635.2021

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Additional snowfall: 5 to 10 cm. Maximum wind gusts: northeasterly 60 km/h along parts of the coast. Locations: Hopedale and vicinity, Postville-Makkovik. Time span: ending this morning. Remarks: The poorest visibilities are expected along exposed areas of the coast this morning. Conditions will improve by midday as winds ease. ### Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. An increasing gradient between a trough over Hudson Bay and a ridge over the NWT has created blizzard-like conditions this morning in Coral Harbour. These conditions will improve this afternoon before a second, more prolonged blizzard event begins overnight tonight and ends late Friday morning. Northeasterly winds of 50 gusting 70 km/h along with some falling snow are expected to develop overnight. The winds will ease during the day on Friday. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-05T07:49:48-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-04T15:50:48-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3294035264.2021
Area: Coral Harbour
properties.Author: Environment Canada
